title: Advocates Hope 'Vacatur' Laws Will Help Prostitutes Clear Their Records
teaser: For the first time in Maryland, a woman with a prostitution conviction has had her criminal record wiped clean by convincing a judge she is actually a victim, forced into the life by brutal pimps. Advocates hope it will be a model in other states.
contentencoded: Copyright 2015 NPR. To see more, visit http://www.npr.org/.
